Comments_List: A firm foundational understanding of operations in forestry practice, and thru the individual project a better grasp on forestry in California.

So many!  I learned all the basics of road design and layout, harvesting equipment, administering timber sales, and all things related to forest operations and management.  I got a lot of insight into the dynamics between different players in a forestry operation and understanding how they interact, what their stakes are, how this effects their values and decisions, where money comes from and where it goes in a logging operation, and how all of this impacts the forest.
I think the class does a great job of providing students with a lot of information on what goes into forestry. No suggestions here!

All of the information in the class was important, relevant, and well delivered.  The time we had in the field was great but I would have loved more of it.  This may not be feasible though so I think considering the circumstances, we made the best of all available field time.
Definitely take this class, especially if you are unfamiliar with the operations side of forestry.
If you plan to be at all involved with timber harvesting operations in the future, you should DEFINITELY take this class.
